Class ec.util.URLLaunchThread 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----ec.util.URLLaunchThread
public class URLLaunchThread
extends Thread
This class does nothing but call the Native.openURL() method and wait for it to return. It was created because there is sometimes a delay in the native code, and this is unacceptable when its called by the E Delivery thread. So, we spawn off a thread to wait for the native call, anc the E Delivery thread can continue on its merry way.

URLLaunchThread(String)

run()
If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns.

URLLaunchThread 
 public URLLaunchThread(String url)

run 
 public void run()
If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns.
